DataElement.preferredName: Southwest Oncology Group Patient Registration Eligibility Determination S0812 Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: a subdivision for registration into S0812 as related to the act of determining if a Southwest Oncology Group, an NCI-sponsored cooperative group, an adult cancer clinical trials organization, subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria  and procedures.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Southwest Oncology Group Patient Registration Eligibility Determination
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the act of determining if a Southwest Oncology Group, an NCI-sponsored cooperative group, an adult cancer clinical trials organization, subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria  and procedures.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The Southwest Oncology Group (SWOG) is an NCI-sponsored cooperative group, an adult cancer clinical trials organization, one of the largest in the world. The group was established in 1956 and is headquartered in San Antonio, TX. Its network consists of almost 4,000 of the physicians at 283 institutions throughout the US and Canada. The major goal of the SWOG since 1990 has been to enroll more women and minority patients in cancer treatment and control research trials.:A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: An NCI-sponsored cooperative group, an adult cancer clinical trials organization, one of the largest in the world. The group was established in 1956 and is headquartered in San Antonio, TX. Its network consists of almost 4,000 of the physicians at 283 institutions throughout the US and Canada. The major goal of the SWOG since 1990 has been to enroll more women and minority patients in cancer treatment and control research trials.
A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredDefinition: Registration; the act of enrolling.:Criteria to determine eligibility of patients for medical care programs and services.

Concepts.definition: The act of listing or recording officially; officially qualified or enrolled.
The act of determining if a subject is suitable for enrollment in a study according specific protocol criteria and procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A low voltage X-ray photograph of the breast generally done to detect breast cancer. This method is also valuable in diagnosis of benign abnormal conditions of the breast such as fibroadenoma, mastitis, abscess, and cysts.:Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: A low voltage X-ray photograph of the breast generally done to detect breast cancer. This method is also valuable in diagnosis of benign abnormal conditions of the breast such as fibroadenoma, mastitis, abscess, and cysts.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
